sourceDates.note: Accessed; no explicit last updated date visible.
Accessed; dynamic content not fully rendered during this check.

policyFindings: Aeroméxico accepts cats and dogs as pets; exotic species are not accepted.
Pets younger than 8 weeks are not accepted.
In-cabin pets (PETC) allowed up to 9 kg total (pet + carrier); rigid or soft carrier; pet must remain inside; limited availability and advance request required.
Some Aeroméxico copy notes in-cabin pets are allowed only on flights up to 6 hours; verify for your specific itinerary.
Checked pets (AVIH) permitted in the hold for larger animals with an approved hard kennel; advance reservation and a valid health certificate are required.
A valid veterinary health certificate is required; confirm any route-specific documentation.
Fees for in-cabin/hold transport were not displayed on the accessible pages; confirm at booking or via Aeroméxico contact center.
Exact carrier size dimensions were not published on the accessible pages; confirm maximum dimensions by aircraft/route with Aeroméxico.
Service animals: a dedicated detailed policy page was not retrieved in this check; contact Aeroméxico to confirm requirements for trained service dogs on your route.
Embargoes, temperature limits, and breed restrictions were not visible on the accessible pages; confirm directly with Aeroméxico.

Emotional Support Animals (ESAs): Aeroméxico copy indicates ESAs may be accepted in cabin with medical documentation and prior approval; details and route applicability not shown—confirm with the airline.
notes: The policy hub appears to load content dynamically; scraper did not render full text. Findings are based on Aeroméxico’s Flights/Vuelos with pets pages and accessible support pages.
Confirm route/aircraft specifics including fees, per-flight pet limits, kennel size allowances, temperature thresholds, and any breed restrictions directly with Aeroméxico before booking.

Operator-provided 'dangerous breeds' list (Akita Inu, Doberman, Fila Brasileiro, Belgian Malinois, Anatolian Shepherd, Rottweiler, Japanese Tosa) could not be verified on accessible Aeroméxico pages; treat as unverified and confirm with the airline.

International travel typically requires a veterinary health certificate, proof of vaccinations (e.g., rabies), import/export permits for some countries, and microchip where required; verify per origin/destination.

For U.S. entry: as of 2024-08-01, CDC requires dogs to be at least 6 months old, microchipped, and accompanied by a CDC Dog Import Form receipt; additional documents may apply based on travel history.

finalDoc.PetPolicySummary: Aeromexico allows cats and dogs to travel in the cabin in an approved carrier placed under the seat in front of the passenger. Cats, dogs, and birds may travel as checked-in baggage subject to availability and restrictions. Brachycephalic and dangerous breeds are subject to strict limitations.
finalDoc.ImprovedPetPolicySummary:
Aeroméxico Pet Policy Summary

  • In-cabin pets (PETC): Cats and dogs are allowed in an approved carrier placed under the seat.
  • Checked-in baggage: Cats, dogs, and birds are allowed unless classified as brachycephalic or dangerous.
  • Brachycephalic breeds: Not permitted as checked-in baggage unless a veterinarian certifies the animal is not brachycephalic.
  • Dangerous breeds: Not accepted under any circumstances.
finalDoc.inCompartmentDetails:
- The combined weight of the pet and carrier must not exceed 9 kg (19.8 lbs).
- Maximum carrier dimensions: 40 cm x 30 cm x 20 cm (16 x 12 x 8 inches).
- Pets must be at least 8 weeks old.
- Only one pet per passenger is permitted.
- Pets must remain inside the carrier under the seat for the entire flight.
- Flights with pets in cabin are limited to a maximum duration of 6 hours.
finalDoc.inCargoDetails:
- The combined weight of the pet and carrier must not exceed 45 kg (99 lbs).
- Pets must be clean, healthy, harmless, and non-aggressive.
- Passengers are responsible for any damages caused by their pet.
- IMPORTANT: Pets classified as dangerous breeds are NOT permitted to travel as checked-in baggage under any circumstances.
- IMPORTANT: Brachycephalic breeds are NOT permitted as checked-in baggage unless a veterinarian declaration certifies the animal is not brachycephalic.
finalDoc.carrierCompartmentDetails:
In-Cabin Carrier Requirements

  • Flexible or soft-sided carrier
  • One-piece absorbent base
  • Adequate ventilation
  • Enough space for the pet to turn and lie down naturally
  • Only one pet per carrier

Total weight (pet + carrier) must not exceed 9 kg.
finalDoc.carrierCargoDetails:
Checked-In Carrier Requirements

  • IATA-compliant kennel
  • Adequate ventilation
  • Secure locking mechanism
  • Enough space for natural posture and turning

Brachycephalic and dangerous breeds are not accepted.
finalDoc.brachycephalicBreedList: Cats: Burmese; Exotic Shorthair; Himalayan; Persian. Dogs: Affenpinscher; American Bully; American Staffordshire Terrier; Boston Terrier; Brussels Griffon; Boxer (all breeds); Bulldog (all breeds); Bull Mastiff; Cane Corso; Cavalier King Charles; Chow Chow; Argentine Dogo; Bordeaux Mastiff; English Toy Spaniel; Japanese Spaniel; Lhasa Apso; Maltese Bichon; Mastiff (all breeds); Newfoundland; Canary Dog; Pekingese; Pug (all breeds); Saint Bernard; Shar-pei; Shih-tzu; Toy English Spaniel; Tibetan Spaniel; Yorkshire Terrier; Cavalier Spaniel. Any brachycephalic cat or dog, even if not specifically listed. If a pet appears brachycephalic, a veterinarian declaration proving the animal is not brachycephalic is required for acceptance.
finalDoc.serviceAnimalDetails:
Service Animals

Only dogs are accepted as service animals. No additional fees apply. Animals must behave appropriately and remain on the floor at the passenger’s feet.
finalDoc.esaDetails:
Emotional Support Animals

Dogs and cats may be accepted as emotional support animals with proper documentation and size limits. Breed restrictions still apply. Emotional support animals are not permitted on flights to London.
